turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: A videotape.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Who's it from?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I don't know... There's no return address on the envelope... In fact, there's no address on it.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Does it say anything on the tape?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: No, nothing.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: It must be from a real estate agent.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Good book, huh?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Huh?... oh, yeah, it is.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Same one you were reading the other night?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: What night?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: When you didn't come to the club.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Oh. Oh, yeah. No. This is a different one.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I called, you know.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Called? When?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: From the club. You didn't answer.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I must have fallen asleep. I was asleep when you got home, wasn't I?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: You were asleep when I got home, yes.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I had a dream about you last night...

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: You were in the house... calling my name... but I couldn't find you.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: You're up early.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: That dog woke me. I lay there for a while, then decided to get up.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Who the hell owns that dog?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What's that? Another tape?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Yes, I just found it on the step.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Don't you want to watch it?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: We've got to call the police.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Two detectives are coming out.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: We will.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Thanks, guys.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: What the hell is going on?!

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I wish I knew.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: What was that?!!!

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: On the tape! There was something else on the tape.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: No, I don't remember anything. it looks like I... but... I don't remember.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Why would anyone do something like this?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Where would you feel safe?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe a hotel.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I'll make sure the alarm is set from now on.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: But that doesn't solve the problem. Who is doing this? And why?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I thought you were getting me a drink?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Just a minute.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Let's go home.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Now! We're leaving now! I didn't want to come here in the first place.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: It was a long time ago... I met him at this place called Moke's... We... became friends... He told me about a job...

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What job?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I don't remember... Anyway, Andy's okay...

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: He's got some fucked up friends.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I told you to stay in the car!

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Why? what is it? Why did you make me wait out here?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I thought there might be somebody inside.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Was there?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: No... of course not.

turns.speaker: RAQUEL
turns.text: Did you see that about the guy who chopped up his wife into a million pieces?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: How could I miss it? The TV won't quit with that stuff.

turns.speaker: RAQUEL
turns.text: They're gonna cook him.

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Andy's from Utah. He says there you have a choice... You can die by hanging or by firing squad.

turns.speaker: RAQUEL
turns.text: Which would you choose?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: Andy would go for this, don't you think?... Firing squad, definitely.

turns.speaker: RAQUEL
turns.text: Do they aim for the head or for the heart?

turns.speaker: MARIAN
turns.text: The heart, I guess.

turns.speaker: RAQUEL
turns.text: I wouldn't... The brain would know what's going on. Your heart would be ripped open trying to pump blood, blood pouring into the chest cavity. Savage pain, Marian.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: What happened? Somebody givin' you trouble?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No, it's nothin'... I'm all right.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Because if anybody's givin' you trouble, Pete, I can take care of the problem... like that.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No, no... It's okay, Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I mean it, Pete... Like THAT!!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Thanks, Mr. Eddy... whatiya need? Just the regular tune-up?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I want you to ride with me. Somethin' doesn't sound right.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Okay... Lemme clear it with...

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: It's okay with Arnie... Come on, let's go.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Give that a try.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: All right!

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Beautiful! Smooth as shit from a duck's ass. Let's take a ride.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Whatever you say, Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Sorry about that, Pete, but tailgating is one thing I can't tolerate.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I can see that.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I'll bet you know how many car lengths it takes to stop at... say 45 m.p.h.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Eight, nine car lengths. A hundred and sixty-two feet.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: At sixty?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Fifteen car lengths. About two hundred and seventy feet.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: What'd I tell ya.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Thanks, Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: No... Thank you!... I'll be bringin' the "Caddy" by tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You like pornos?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Pornos?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Yeah. Give ya a boner.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No thanks, Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Suit yourself, champ.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Okay... Well, I'll see ya then.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You will.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I'm leavin' the Caddy, like I told you. Think you'll get a chance to give her a once over today?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sure... Sure, Mr. Eddy. You gonna pick it up later, or tomorrow?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: If you think you can finish it, I'll be back later today.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: It'll be ready.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You're my man, Pete.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: How ya doin', Pete?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I'm sure you noticed that girl that was with me the other day... Good lookin' blonde? She stayed in the car?...

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Her name is Alice. You know I love that girl to death. If I ever found out somebody was makin' out with her, I'd take this...  ...and shove it so far up his ass it would come out his mouth... Then you know what?...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I'd pull the trigger and shoot him right between the eyes.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Hey, Pete... How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You know who it is.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Mr. Eddy?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: Yeah... How ya doin', Pete?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You're doin, okay?  That's good, Pete.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Look... It's late, Mr. Eddy... I ...

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: I'm really glad you're doin' okay, Pete.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: You sure you're doin' okay? Everything all right?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: That's good, Pete. Hey... I want you to talk to a friend of mine.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I don't think so. Where was it that you think we've met?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: At your house. Don't you remember?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No. No, I don't.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We just killed a couple of people...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Great question!! In the east... the far east... when a person is sentenced to death... they're sent to a place where they can't escape... never knowing when an executioner will step up behind them and fire a bullet into the back of their head... it could be days... weeks... or even years after the death sentence has been pronounced... This uncertainty adds an exquisite element of torture to the situation, don't you think? It's been a pleasure talking to you.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I missed you.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah?...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What are you guys doin'?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Guess we're goin' over to the "Ten Pin".

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You want some company?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Why haven't you called me?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sorry... I...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What's happening to you? What happened to your face?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What do you mean?... You've been acting strange lately... Like the other night.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What night?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Last time I saw you.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I don't remember... What happened that night?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You sure weren't acting like the Pete Dayton I've always known.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Whatiya mean?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You were acting like a different person.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You still care about me?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sure. Sure I do.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What else about that night?... Did anything happen?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You really don't remember?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No... I told you.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: It was weird...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Whatiya mean, Sheila?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sheila?!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: No... I really don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Nothin'... You want to go for a drive?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Come on... get in.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Why don't you like me?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I do like you, Sheila.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Where'd you come from?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I've been here. You were lookin, right at me.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I was?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I didn't know you cared.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sheila, what is it?... What are you doin' here?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You've been fucking somebody else haven't you?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sheila...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: You fuck me whenever you want... You don't call... Tell me who she is.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Hey... Sheila.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What's the BITCH'S name?!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Look Sheila... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: YOU'RE SORRY!!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Go home, Sheila.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sheila... Stop...

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: FUCK YOU!! FUCK YOU!!

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Cable from Gainsford.

turns.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY
turns.text: Oh, read it!

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: "Leaving today for London with Conway aboard S.S. Manchuria. Conway can tell nothing of his experiences. Is suffering from complete loss of memory. Signed, Gainsford."

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: All of it?

turns.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes. Might as well - all of it.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY
turns.text: I'll dispatch a convoy to meet him.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Conway's gone again! Run out! Listen to this! From Gainsford.

turns.speaker: ASSISTANT SECRETARY
turns.text: Let me have it.  "Aboard the S.S. Manchuria. Last night Conway seemed to recover his memory. Kept talking about Shangri- La, telling a fantastic story about a place in Tibet. Insisted upon returning there at once. Locked him in room but he escaped us and jumped ship during night at Singapore. Am leaving ship myself to overtake him, as fearful of his condition. Wrote down details of Conway's story about Shangri-La which I am forwarding. Lord Gainsford."

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Where's the girl? Miss Stone.

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: She's remaining in her room. She isn't feeling very well.  Now please go on without me. I eat very little.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Well, there's certainly nothing wrong with that meal!

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Not even a radio?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: It's always been a source of deep regret, but the mountains surrounding us have made reception almost impossible.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: What about those men we met this morning?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Yes. Those are our own people. They never venture beyond the point where you were met this morning. It is much too hazardous.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Two years!?

turns.speaker: CHANG
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I beg your pardon, brother. What did you say you were hunting?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Fossils.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Fossils, huh?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I'm a paleontologist.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: A paleontologist.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Oh, I see.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I have here a discovery that will startle the world. It's the vertebrae from the lumbar of a Megatherium,[4] found in Asia.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Well, what do you know about that!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Found in Asia!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: When I get home I shall probably be knighted for it.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Knighted! You don't say. Do you mind if I take a look at it?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Not at all.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: This is the only thing I was able to save when those heathens surrounded me.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: You see, from this vertebrae I shall be able to reconstruct the entire skeleton.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Wait a minute, you expect to be knighted for finding that soupbone?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: It was the vertebrae of a Megatherium - found in Asia.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yeah, I remember. You said that before.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Sir Henry Derwent was knighted, and he never got beyond the mesozoic era.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Yes, it just shows  I don't know why I'm talking to you. I don't know you. Who are you?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Okay, brother.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Don't call me brother.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Okay, sister.  No offense. No offense!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Good morning, Lovey.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I beg your pardon.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I say, good morning, Lovey.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Good morning

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I didn't care for 'sister' last night, and I don't like 'Lovey' this morning. My name is Lovett - Alexander, P.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Well, it's a good morning, anyway.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I'm never conversational before I coffee.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Wait a minute. Is it a good morning? Say, we're supposed to be traveling east, aren't we?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Why, of course. Yes.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Well, it looks to me as if we're traveling west.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Is it?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: It certainly is.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Look here

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Any child knows how to tell direction. Any child. I don't care where the child is - in the air, on the earth, or in the sea. If you face the rising sun, your right hand is the north, and your left hand is the south

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I always get it twisted because I'm left-handed.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Oh, really?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Well, you just reverse it. Your left hand is  What difference does it make what 'hand' you are? The north is the north!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Uh-huh. All I know is - the sun rises in the east, and we're going away from it.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Now you're irritating and absurd!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: He might have lost his way.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Of course. That's what I told them last night. You can't expect a man to sail around in the dark.[5] During this George has been looking around - he rises.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Yes. And who is he ? How'd he get there?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Do you suppose we stopped someplace during the night and changed pilots?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Left us here to rot. That's what they've done. Heroes of the newspapers!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: All right, all right. Keep quiet.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Where are they? Do you see them?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Do you think they're cannibals?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Mr. Barnard, I do not like this place. I definitely do not like this place.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Will you stop squawking!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Look at me. Look at what they gave me to wear.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: You never looked better in your life. As soon as our clothes are cleaned, they're going to give them back to us, Lovey.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Something tells me this means food. Come on!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I just feel as though I'm being made ready for the executioner.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yeah? If this be execution, lead me to it.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: That's what they do with cattle just before the slaughter. Fatten them.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Uh-huh. You're a scream, Lovey.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Please don't call me Lovey.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Some layout they got here. Did you get a load of the rooms? You couldn't do better at the Ritz.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: All the conveniences for the condemned, if you ask me.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Don't mind Lovey. He's got the misery.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Mr. Conway, I don't like this place. I don't like it. It's too mysterious.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: How about you Lovey? Come on. Let's you and I play a game of honeymoon bridge.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I'm thinking.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Thinking? What about some double solitaire?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I'm very good at double solitaire.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: No kidding?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Then I'm your man.  Come on, Toots.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: And say, honey, you look a million per cent better. Wholesome, kind of - and clean. You take a tip from me, and don't you ever put that stuff on your face again. Why, it's like hiding behind a mask.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Ha, ha - who are you to be talking about a mask? What do you mean? You've been wearing a mask ever since we met you.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Have I?

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: It's very strange, you know. You've never told us anything about yourself. Who are you, anyway? Why don't you take your mask off for once!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Certainly not.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Believe me, it's no fun. When you fellas picked me up at Baskul, they'd been on my tail for a year.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: The police?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Did you ever hear of Chalmers Bryant?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: That's too bad. I got a half million shares. My whole foundation! And now look at me!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: colossal nerve you have sitting there and talking about it so calmly - you, the swindler of thousands of people

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: You know, that's what makes the whole thing so funny. A guy like me starts out in life as a plumber - an ordinary, everyday, slew-footed plumber - and by the use of a little brains, mind you, he builds up a gigantic institution, employs thousands of people, becomes a great civic leader. And then the crash comes - and overnight he's the biggest crook the country ever had.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: You are a thief, sir, and a swindler, and I, for one, will be only too glad to turn you over to the police when we get back.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Sounds like a stall to me.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: I don't know why I associate with you, Mr. Barnard - or Mr. Chalmers Bryant - or Mr. Embezzler - or whatever your name may be.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Just call me Barney.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Barney? Why should I? Never! We have nothing in common. Hmmpf, Barney! What effrontery!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Okay, Lovey.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: And this trip to the valley. I can't imagine why I'd allow you to drag me down here. Why, we don't know anything about these people. We're not even armed!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: They're very nice people - except that they've got horns.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Horns?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yeah. You know.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Horns? What kind of horns?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Hey Lovey, come here! Lovey, I asked for a glass of wine and look what I got. Come on, sit down.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: So that's where you are. I might of known it. No wonder you couldn't hear me.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: You were asked to have a glass of wine. Sit down!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: And be poisoned out here in the open?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Certainly not!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: There you are!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: This doesn't obligate me in any way.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: then the bears came right into the bedroom and the little baby bear said, "Oh, somebody's been sleeping in my bed." And then the mama bear said, "Oh dear, somebody's been sleeping in my bed!" And then the big papa bear, he roared, "And somebody's been sleeping in my bed!" Well, you have to admit the poor little bears were in a quandary!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I'm going to sleep in my bed. Come on, Lovey!

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: They were in a quandary, and

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Come on, Lovey.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Why? Why 'come on' all the time? What's the matter?  Are you going to be a fuss budget all your life? Here, drink it up! Aren't you having any fun? Where was I?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: In a quandary.

turns.speaker: LOVETT
turns.text: Oh my, isn't that pretty! What is it?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Plumbing. Everything modern. I'm going to run pipes all through the village

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Charming chap.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Nice puss to meet in a dark alley.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Well, that's that, I guess.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Wonder what's happened to Fenner.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Well, there's nothing we can do until the morning.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: It's better than freezing to death down below, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I'll say.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: That's what I say. What do you say to a rubber of bridge? I saw some cards in the other room.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Not for me, thanks. No, I'm too weary.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Hey, hurry up, you slow-pokes - I'm starved!

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Please! Please! Do not wait for me! I eat so very little.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Yes. Unbosom yourself, Mr. Hyde.[11]

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: All right, I will! I'll let my hair down! Why not? It can't make any real difference now.  Hey Lovey, were you ever chased by the police?

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Chalmers Bryant!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Bryant's Utilities - that's me.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Yeah. I though you ran this joint.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Mr. Chang - High Lamas or Low Lamas, do we get the porters?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: You see? You get the idea? From this reservoir here I can pipe in the whole works. Oh, I'm going to get a great kick out of this. Of course it's just to keep my hand in, but with the equipment we have here, I can put a plumbing system in for the whole village down there. Can rig it up in no time.  Do you realize those poor people are still going to the well for water?

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: It's unbelievable.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Think of it! In times like these.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Say, what about that gold deal?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: Gold. You were going to

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Oh - that! That can wait. Nobody's going to run off with it.  Say, I've got to get busy. I want to show this whole layout to Chang.  So long. Don't you take any wooden nickels.

turns.speaker: CONWAY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: I say, will you have a cigarette?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Say, you're an American, aren't you?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Say, listen - will you go and annoy the rest of your playmates? Let me alone!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Hey, what's happened to you?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Nothing. Why?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Why, you look beautiful.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Look, honey. We run the pipes through here, and we connect with the main water line here.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Pipes? Where are you going to get pipes?

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Oh, that's a cinch. I'll show them how to cast pipes out of clay.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: If you want me to!

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Sure - sure. Don't you worry. I'll take care of you.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Cave, eh? Where?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Over by that hill.

turns.speaker: BARNARD
turns.text: Hey - look!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look, Bob!
